bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to J. N. Kenealy, August 10, 1946

div1.p: Hench is interested in Kenealy's Latin American experiences related to yellow fever, but lets him know that his main interest is in Reed and the Cuban phase.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to J. N. Kenealy, August 10, 1946
div1.opener:
August 10, 1946
Dr. J. N. Kenealy
Box #1437
Balboa
Canal Zone
My dear Doctor Kenealy:
div1.p:
I was greatly interested in your letter
of August 5. I hope by now you have received the
little article on yellow fever which Doctor Hewitt
asked me to have sent to you. As a physician
interested in the whole story of yellow fever, I am
interested in your experiences and those of your
friends, but I do not want you to go to much trouble
about it as in my own studies I have found it neces-
sary to confine my interests largely to the Cuban
phase of the Conquest of Yellow Fever and in the
work of Walter Reed and his associates. There is
so much unpublished work about the Cuban phase that
I want to cover it thoroughly and I will only be
able to refer to the Pan American phase very briefly.
Nevertheless, I am very glad to have the names and
addresses you have given me as I may find it
possible to change my plans later.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alp
